exceptions.exn: In environment f, g : R -> R x : Rbar Hf : ex_lim f x Hg : ex_lim g x Hmult : ex_Rbar_mult (Lim f x) (Lim g x) Unable to unify "forall P : R -> Prop, Rbar_locally (Lim ?M2363 ?M2364) P -> filtermap ?M2363 (Rbar_locally' ?M2364) P" with "Lim (fun y : R => f y * g y) x = Rbar_mult (Lim f x) (Lim g x)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
g: R -> R
f: R -> R
x: Rbar

Goal:
ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_mult (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> Lim (fun y : R => f y * g y) x = Rbar_mult (Lim f x) (Lim g x)

Premises:
Lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => Lim_seq (fun n : nat => f (Rbar_loc_seq x n)) : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match Rbar_mult' x y with | Some z => z | None => Finite 0 end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
ex_lim = fun (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar) => exists l : Rbar, is_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
ex_Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite _ => True | _ => x0 <> 0 end | _ => match y with | Finite y0 => y0 <> 0 | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
*** [ R : Set ]
Lim_minus : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_minus (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> Lim (fun y : R => f y - g y) x = Rbar_minus (Lim f x) (Lim g x)
Lim_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_plus (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> Lim (fun y : R => f y + g y) x = Rbar_plus (Lim f x) (Lim g x)
ex_lim_mult : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_mult (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun y : R => f y * g y) x
ex_lim_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_plus (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun y : R => f y + g y) x
ex_lim_minus : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x -> ex_Rbar_minus (Lim f x) (Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun y : R => f y - g y) x
Lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> Lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x = Lim f (Lim g x)
ex_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f (Lim g x) -> ex_lim g x -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> Lim g x) -> ex_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x
Lim_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> Lim f x <> 0 -> Lim (fun y : R => / f y) x = Rbar_inv (Lim f x)
ex_lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x
Lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> is_lim f x (Lim f x)
ex_lim_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), (forall y : R, f y = g y) -> ex_lim f x -> ex_lim g x
Lim_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Lim (fun y : R => - f y) x = Rbar_opp (Lim f x)
ex_finite_lim_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_finite_lim f x < -> ex_lim f x /\ is_finite (Lim f x)
Lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> Lim g x = Lim f x
Lim_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : Rbar), (forall y : R, f y = g y) -> Lim g x = Lim f x
is_lim_mult : forall (f g : R -> R) (x lf lg : Rbar), is_lim f x lf -> is_lim g x lg -> ex_Rbar_mult lf lg -> is_lim (fun y : R => f y * g y) x (Rbar_mult lf lg)
Lim_correct' : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_finite_lim f x -> is_lim f x (Lim f x)
is_lim_ext_loc : forall (f g : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => f y = g y) -> is_lim f x l -> is_lim g x l
is_lim_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (x l : Rbar), (forall y : R, f y = g y) -> is_lim f x l -> is_lim g x l
is_lim_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (x lf lg l : Rbar), is_lim f x lf -> is_lim g x lg -> is_Rbar_plus lf lg l -> is_lim (fun y : R => f y + g y) x l
ex_lim_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> Lim f x <> 0 -> ex_lim (fun y : R => / f y) x
is_lim_comp : forall (f g : R -> R) (x k l : Rbar), is_lim f l k -> is_lim g x l -> Rbar_locally' x (fun y : R => g y <> l) -> is_lim (fun x0 : R => f (g x0)) x k
ex_lim_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (x : Rbar), ex_lim f x -> ex_lim (fun y : R => - f y) x
filter_forall : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x) -> ?F P where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_comp_2 : forall (f0 : ?T -> ?U) (g0 : ?T -> ?V) (h : ?U -> ?V -> ?W), filterlim f0 ?F ?G -> filterlim g0 ?F ?H -> filterlim (fun x0 : ?U * ?V => h (fst x0) (snd x0)) (filter_prod ?G ?H) ?I -> filterlim (fun x : ?T => h (f0 x) (g0 x)) ?F ?I where ?T : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?V : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?W : [f : R -> R g : R -> R x : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [f : R ->...-> R x : Rbar |- Filter ?F]

```coq
intros Hf Hg Hmult.
apply Lim_correct.
apply ex_lim_mult with f g; auto.
Qed.

original: intros Hf Hg Hmult. apply Lim_correct. apply ex_lim_mult with f g; auto.
